item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "To hell with facts! We need stories!" -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Why is it we want so badly to memorialize ourselves? Even while we're still alive. We wish to assert our existence, like dogs peeing on fire hydrants." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Only men you can count on these days are Ben and Jerry." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by William James
item.description: "The greatest discovery of any generation is that a human can alter his life by altering his attitude." -- William James

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by William James
item.description: "Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does." -- William James

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by William James
item.description: "Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact." -- William James

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Can you cook and sew, make flowers grow, do you understand my pain? Are you willing to risk it all or is your love in vain?" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Meredith Willson
item.description: ". . . when a woman has a husband And you've got none, Why should she take advice from you? Even if you can quote Balzac and Shakespeare And all them other highfalutin' Greeks. " -- Meredith Willson

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by James Turner
item.description: "Just because I'm a librarian doesn't mean I'm at all tame." -- James Turner

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description:
"The book itself is a curious artifact, not showy in its technology but complex and extremely efficient: a really neat little device, compact, often very pleasant to look at and handle, that can last decades, even centuries. It doesn't have to be plugged in, activated, or performed by a machine; all it needs is light, a human eye, and a human mind. It is not one of a kind, and it is not ephemeral. It lasts. It is reliable. If a book told you something when you were fifteen, it will tell it to you again when you're fifty, though you may understand it so differently that it seems you're reading a whole new book."
(<i>Staying Awake: Notes on the alleged decline of reading</i>, Harper's Magazine, February 2008)" -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Ruth Rendell
item.description: "Some say life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Ruth Rendell

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Anya Seton
item.description: "Nay, it's not the Devil been leading her astray. It's books! That girl has been nothing but trouble ever since she learned how to read." -- Anya Seton

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You wouldn't worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Norbert Elias
item.description: "Death is a problem of the living. Dead people have no problems." -- Norbert Elias

item.title: Mommalibrarian add a quote by Georgette Heyer
item.description: "You're only a man! You've not our gifts! I can tell you! Why, a woman can think of a hundred different things at once, all them contradictory!" -- Georgette Heyer
